"EcoCycle": An AI-powered recycling sorting system that uses computer vision and machine learning algorithms to identify and sort recyclable materials in real-time. The system can be integrated into existing recycling facilities or deployed in public spaces to encourage community participation.

"GreenThumb": A smart gardening system that uses IoT sensors and machine learning algorithms to monitor and optimize plant growth. The system would provide real-time feedback on soil moisture, temperature, and nutrient levels, allowing gardeners to make data-driven decisions to promote healthy plant growth.

"WasteNot": A blockchain-based platform that rewards individuals for reducing, reusing, and recycling waste. The platform would use a points system to track users' waste reduction efforts and reward them with redeemable points that can be exchanged for discounts on sustainable products and services.

"SmartStreet": A smart street furniture system that uses IoT sensors and machine learning algorithms to monitor and optimize urban infrastructure. The system would include smart trash cans, benches, and other street furniture that can detect and report on waste levels, noise pollution, and other urban issues.

"EcoHub": A community-driven platform that connects individuals and businesses with local environmental initiatives and projects. The platform would allow users to find and participate in local clean-ups, volunteer opportunities, and sustainability projects, and also provide a marketplace for sustainable products and services.
